TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract ICodeGenerator

Docs.summary: Defines an interface for generating code.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > In the .NET Framework versions 1.0 and 1.1, code providers consist of implementations of <xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.CodeDomProvider>, <xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.ICodeGenerator>, <xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.ICodeParser>, and <xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.ICodeCompiler>. In the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnlong](~/includes/dnprdnlong-md.md)], the <xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.CodeDomProvider.CreateGenerator%2A>, <xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.CodeDomProvider.CreateParser%2A>, and <xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.CodeDomProvider.CreateCompiler%2A> methods are obsolete, and the methods of <xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.ICodeGenerator> and <xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.ICodeCompiler> are directly available in the <xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.CodeDomProvider> class. You should override those methods in your code provider implementation and not call the base methods.
Developers of compilers can implement this interface to allow people to dynamically generate code in a particular language. This can be used for a variety of purposes, such as creating code-generating wizards, creating dynamic assemblies with content that can be debugged, and for templated documents with embedded code, such as ASP.NET.
An <xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.ICodeGenerator> implementation is typically obtained through a call to the <xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.CodeDomProvider.CreateGenerator%2A> method of <xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.CodeDomProvider>.

MemberSignature.Value: public string CreateEscapedIdentifier (string value);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string CreateEscapedIdentifier(string value) cil managed
Public Function CreateEscapedIdentifier (value As String) As String
public: System::String ^ CreateEscapedIdentifier(System::String ^ value);
abstract member CreateEscapedIdentifier : string -> string

Docs.param: The string to create an escaped identifier for.
Docs.summary: Creates an escaped identifier for the specified value.
Docs.returns: The escaped identifier for the value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.ICodeGenerator.CreateEscapedIdentifier%2A> tests whether the identifier conflicts with reserved or language keywords, and if so, returns an equivalent name with language-specific escape code formatting. This is referred to an escaped identifier. The escaped identifier will contain the same `value` but will have escape code formatting added to differentiate the identifier from the keyword. Two implementation examples are preceding the `value` with "@" or bracketing the `value` with "[" and "]".

Docs.permission: for full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
for full trust for inheritors. This member cannot be inherited by partially trusted code.

MemberSignature.Value: public string CreateValidIdentifier (string value);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string CreateValidIdentifier(string value) cil managed
Public Function CreateValidIdentifier (value As String) As String
public: System::String ^ CreateValidIdentifier(System::String ^ value);
abstract member CreateValidIdentifier : string -> string

Docs.param: The string to generate a valid identifier for.
Docs.summary: Creates a valid identifier for the specified value.
Docs.returns: A valid identifier for the specified value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.ICodeGenerator.CreateValidIdentifier%2A> tests whether the identifier conflicts with reserved or language keywords, and returns a valid identifier name that does not conflict. The returned identifier will contain the same `value` but, if it conflicts with reserved or language keywords, will have escape code formatting added to differentiate the identifier from the keyword. Typically, if the value needs modification, value is returned preceded by an underscore "_".

Docs.permission: for full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
for full trust for inheritors. This member cannot be inherited by partially trusted code.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool IsValidIdentifier (string value);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool IsValidIdentifier(string value) cil managed
Public Function IsValidIdentifier (value As String) As Boolean
public: bool IsValidIdentifier(System::String ^ value);
abstract member IsValidIdentifier : string -> bool

Docs.param: The value to test for being a valid identifier.
Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the specified value is a valid identifier for the current language.
Docs.returns: if the parameter is a valid identifier; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method tests whether an identifier is valid. When implementing <xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.ICodeGenerator.IsValidIdentifier%2A> in a derived class, design the method to test the value passed to it, and return `true` only if the value fits the rules of the language and does not conflict with a keyword.

Docs.permission: for full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
for full trust for inheritors. This member cannot be inherited by partially trusted code.

public: bool Supports(System::CodeDom::Compiler::GeneratorSupport supports);
abstract member Supports : System.CodeDom.Compiler.GeneratorSupport -> bool

Docs.param: The capabilities to test the generator for.
Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the generator provides support for the language features represented by the specified object.
Docs.returns: if the specified capabilities are supported; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method can be called with a number of <xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.GeneratorSupport> flags at once to test for a set of capabilities by joining a set of appropriate capability flags together with a binary "Or" operator (|).

Docs.permission: for full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
for full trust for inheritors. This member cannot be inherited by partially trusted code.

MemberSignature.Value: public void ValidateIdentifier (string value);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ValidateIdentifier(string value) cil managed
Public Sub ValidateIdentifier (value As String)
public: void ValidateIdentifier(System::String ^ value);
abstract member ValidateIdentifier : string -> unit

Docs.param: The identifier to validate.
Docs.summary: Throws an exception if the specified value is not a valid identifier.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Rather than returning a value, this method throws an exception if the specified identifier is not valid according to the method implementation. Typically, the exception is an <xref:System.ArgumentException>. This method enables a code generator that implements this method to produce an informative error message based upon the value of an invalid identifier.

Docs.permission: for full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
for full trust for inheritors. This member cannot be inherited by partially trusted code.
